"Send the remote order to your lost cellphone. Do the following to minimize your loss. Note: If the SIM/UIM card has been changed, send it to the new mobile number. The operational code is case insensitive."

"Example: If your LeSafe password is 123456, send 123456#XH to the lost cellphone via SMS, and the private data (including Contacts, Call history, SMS, Schedule, Browser history, E-mail and PUSH account) will be destroyed."

1. The secure cellphone receives a SMS alert once a strange SIM card is inserted.
2. Remote control of the LeSafe password can be achieved by sending the LeSafe password#operation order to the lost cellphone, as shown below:
2. Backup requirements: Fill in the correct mailbox address and enable the mobile data network
3. Trigger backup: Data will be backed up to the mailbox automatically before data is destroyed or when user clicks Backup now
4. Mail text: The received mail includes use method and two attachments. Download the attachments and use them by the method described in the mail

Do you want to restart it?
Common question 1: What advantages does LeSafe own?
Common question 2. How to download LeSafe and how to upgrade it?
Common question 3. Can LeSafe be reinstalled after being uninstalled?
Common question 4. What to do if forgot LeSafe password?
Common question 5. Whether cellphone root or refresh has influence on normal use of LeSafe?
Common question 7. LeSafe supports dual sim phone?

"Answer: LeSafe is a cellphone security software designed by Lenovo security team. LeSafe has functions of harassment blocking, privacy protection and arbitrary charging blocker etc., and can prohibit any security attack, fraud, charging and privacy peep. Also, it provides the system optimization function such as cellphone acceleration, to be used for clearing spam files and data in the system and optimizing the performance of the cellphone, thus making the cellphone run easily and fast.It really achieves I own while others does not own, I'm the best while others own because its exclusive Root permission."
Answer: LeSafe is pre-installed onto phone at default. User can upgrade by Update on cellphone, and can also download and install it by visiting the website safe.lenovo.com.

Answer: LeSafe is pre-installed onto LePhone. It cannot be installed after it is uninstalled. You can visit lenovo.com to download the official firmware or contact the after-sales center to refresh the original system back.

"Answer: LeSafe has no default password, and needs to be set by user. For LeSafe V3.6 or below, password cannot be retrieved back if forgot. If forgot, user can perform as follows: Step 1: Make backup for information in the cellphone (Recommend use LeSyno) Step 2: Restore the cellphone's factory settings Step 3: Upgrade LeSafe Step 4:Set a secure password in LeSafe Users with LeSafe V4.1 or above can retrieve password back by the question for security."
Answer: The cellphone rooting or refreshing may affect normal use of LeSafe. It is recommended that use it in the original system environment.

Answer: Mark is one of the functions used for blocking unwanted calls. When there is strange call, we will provide the mark information about this number, to help you confirm his/her identity. Meanwhile, you can also mark his or her identity after answering the call.
Answer: Support the preloaded LeSafe V3.5 and above the Lenovo dual card phone.
Click OK to help us collect error information, thus we can make improvement for our software to offer better services for you.
